\text{If }M = \frac{5}{2}\int\dfrac{2x+4}{\sqrt{x^2+4x+10}}dx, \\ \text{then has M been evaluated correctly below?}
step.reason: \int t^{n} dt = \dfrac{t^{n+1}}{n+1} + C.\text{In this case, }n=-\frac{1}{2}.\\ \therefore \frac{5}{2}\int\dfrac{dt}{\sqrt{t}} = \frac{5}{2}\cdot\frac{1}{\frac{1}{2}}t^{\frac{1}{2}} = 5\sqrt{t} + C_1

\text{You can convert any quadratic polynomial into}\\ (x\pm a)^2\pm b^2\text{ form. And so, we went from}\\ x^2+4x+10\rightarrow (x+2)^2 + 6 \rightarrow \int\dfrac{dx}{\sqrt{(x+2)^2+(\sqrt{6})^2}}\\ \text{After that, we simply applied used result for }\\ \int\frac{dx}{\sqrt{x^2 + m^2}}dx
